text: {| class="infobox" |- |5th Parliament |(1812) |- |6th Parliament |(1818) |- |7th Parliament |(1820) |- |8th Parliament |(1826) |- |9th Parliament |(1830) |} This is a list of MPs elected to the House of Commons at the 7th 1820 United Kingdom general election, arranged by constituency. The Parliament was summoned 21 April 1820 and dissolved 2 June 1826. The Prime Minister throughout was the leader of the Tory Party, the Earl of Liverpool. __NOTOC__ {| border="0" id="toc" style="margin: 0 auto;" align=center | Table of contents: A B C D E F G H I K L M N O P Q R S T W Y Changes |} {| class="wikitable" |- | colspan=3 bgcolor=ccccff | == A == |- !Constituency!!MP!!Party |- |Aberdeen Burghs||Joseph Hume||Whig |- |Aberdeenshire||James Ferguson|| Tory |- |Abingdon||John Maberly||Whig |- |rowspan="2"|Aldborough (two members)||Henry Fynes Clinton|||Tory |- |Gibbs Antrobus|||Tory |- |rowspan="2"|Aldeburgh (two members)|| Joshua Walker||Tory |- |James Blair||Tory |- |rowspan="2"|Amersham (two members)||William Tyrwhitt-Drake||Tory |- |Thomas Tyrwhitt-Drake||Tory |- |rowspan="2"|Andover (two members)||Thomas Assheton Smith||Tory |- |John Pollen||Tory |- |Anglesey|| Henry Paget||Whig |- |Anstruther Burghs||Sir William Rae, Bt||Tory |- |rowspan="2"|County Antrim (two members)||Hon.
